title.narrative: Livelihood Support for the Vulnerable Groups in the affected Areas of Typhoon Haiyan of the Philippines through Rural Agro-Value Chain Development

description.narrative:
Following the devastating typhoon November 2013, the department of trade and industry has requested UNIDO to support in the livelihood recovery and agro-value chain development of vulnerable groups in the affect areas of Typhoon Haiyan. The overarching goal of the project is to contribute to the economic recovery and poverty reduction of the vulnerable groups (women, youth and affected people) in the devastated areas of Typhoon Haiyan (Yolanda). The specific objective is to improve the livelihood (income generation and employment according to Yolanda livelihood rehabilitation cluster plan) of vulnerable groups through value addition of rural agro-value chain in Region VII and Region VIII of the Philippines (Handicrafts, Dried Fish, intercropping mechanized techniques, etc.). More specifically the project aims at (i) supporting the government in performing value chain analysis of various rural agro value chains, (ii) supporting in the establishment of Shared Service Facilities (SSF) and Business Resource Centers that aims at supporting vulnerable groups and MSMEs and lastly (iii) enhancing the capacity of the affected communities through sills and entrepreneurship training.
The expected results of the project are: (i) Improved sources of income and employment of the affected individuals and communities; (ii) revival of the local economy of the affected areas, and lastly (iii) increased institutional capacity of the government in supporting vulnerable groups and MSMEs.
